questions.text: Which of the following best describes Hepatorenal syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Acute liver failure that occurs in patients due to renal pathology

options.label: B
options.text: Functional renal failure with renal pathology that occurs in patients with advanced cirrhosis or acute liver failure

options.label: C
options.text: Functional renal failure without renal pathology that occurs in patients with advanced cirrhosis or acute liver failure

options.label: D
options.text: Acute liver failure that occurs in patients due to functional renal failure without renal pathology

questions.correct_answer: C. Functional renal failure without renal pathology that occurs in patients with advanced cirrhosis or acute liver failure
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Functional renal failure without renal pathology that occurs in patients with advanced cirrhosis or acute liver failure HRS is a form of functional renal failure without renal pathology that occurs in about 10% of patients with advanced cirrhosis or acute liver failure . Diagnosis of Hepatorenal Syndrome(HRS) Cirrhosis with ascites, Diagnosis of AKI according to the international club of Ascites-AKI No improvement in creatinine with two days of Diuretic withdrawal and albumin, No shock, No Nephrotoxic drugs, No intrinsic kidney disease Pathophysiology of Hepatorenal syndrome is Follows.

Extraedge:

Divided into two types based on e-GFR HRS -AKD—eGFR<60ml/min for<3 months HRS-CKD—-eGFR<60ml/min for.>3 months Newer classification of Hepatorenal syndrome subtypes is as follows.

questions.text: Which of the following lab pictures suggests Type 2 Hepatorenal syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Progressive impairment in renal function and a significant reduction in creatinine clearance within 1-2 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Reduction in glomerular filtration rate with an elevation of serum creatinine level, but it is fairly stable

options.label: C
options.text: Progressive impairment in renal function and a significant increase in creatinine clearance within 1-2 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Reduction in glomerular filtration rate with a decrease of serum creatinine level, but it is fairly stable

questions.correct_answer: B. Reduction in glomerular filtration rate with an elevation of serum creatinine level, but it is fairly stable
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Reduction in glomerular filtration rate with an elevation of serum creatinine level, but it is fairly stable It is relatively stable and is associated with better outcomes when compared to type 1 HRS.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A, C. Type 1 HRS is characterized by a progressive impairment in renal function and a significant reduction in creatinine clearance within 1–2 weeks of presentation. Option: D. There is an increase in serum creatinine.

questions.text: The best treatment for Hepatorenal syndrome is?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Liver transplantation The definite treatment or HRS is liver transplantation. Drugs used in treatment include Terlipressin Norepinephrine Midodrine+Octreotide Albumin

Highyeild:

TIPS placement -is helpful in significant ascites Vasoconstrictors+/-colloid(Terlipressin+albumin)is the medical management of choice. Prevention of HRS Patients with SBP should be volume expanded with Albumin Prophylaxis against Bacterial infections, incredibly spontaneous bacterial peritonitis

questions.text: All of the following about hepatorenal syndrome are true EXCEPT?

options.label: A
options.text: Better prognosis is seen in the case of type 1 HRS than in Type 2

options.label: B
options.text: Refractory ascites characterize type 2 hepatorenal syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: Type 1 HRS persists despite volume administration and withholding of diuretics

options.label: D
options.text: The hepatorenal syndrome is difficult to distinguish from prerenal azotemia

questions.correct_answer: A. Better prognosis is seen in the case of type 1 HRS than in Type 2
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Better prognosis is seen in the case of type 1 HRS than in Type 2 HRS is a Functional Renal disease in patients with CLD an inferior prognosis is seen in the case of type 1 hepatorenal syndrome.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: B. Type 2 hepatorenal syndrome is a less severe form characterized mainly by refractory ascites. Option: C. True Option: D. The hepatorenal syndrome, defined as it is above, is difficult to distinguish from prerenal azotemia.
